page.title: 01CHURCHILL SUMMARISED
page.content: Churchill is a Cotswold village of some 400 residents. It is dominated by a large church built on the hill, and is constructed mainly of stone. It is overwhelmingly a residential village, commercial activities being peripheral, with the exception of farming. It is not large enough to support a school, and its proximity to the market town of Chipping Norton means that a village shop is not viable. However within five miles it can boast of good local facilities , trains, buses, supermarkets, doctors, vets, even a small theatre/cinema. This is a sought-after village for those who can afford the rather high property prices and have their own transport, but those without find the local bus service limited. There is some council housing, intended for young families and the elderly.
